intro: Codonopsis gongshanica, commonly known as the Gongshan Codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Yunnan Province. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its erect stem and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions at elevations ranging from 2,000 to 3,500 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are usually pale blue or white in color. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
